7.verse: The ·lands [border] of Manasseh ·were in the area between Asher and [ran from Asher to] Micmethath, ·near [or east of] Shechem. The border went south to the ·En Tappuah area [inhabitants of En Tappuah],

8.verse: which belonged to Manasseh, except for the town of Tappuah. It was along the border of Manasseh’s land and belonged to the ·sons [people; tribe] of Ephraim.

9.verse: The border of Manasseh continued south to Kanah ·Ravine [Valley; or Brook]. The cities in this area of Manasseh belonged to Ephraim. Manasseh’s border was on the north side of the ravine and went to the sea.

10.verse: The land to the south belonged to Ephraim, and the land to the north belonged to Manasseh. The ·Mediterranean Sea [sea] was the western border. The border touched Asher’s land on the north and Issachar’s land on the east.

11.verse: In the areas of Issachar and Asher, the people of Manasseh ·owned [included; had] these towns: Beth ·Shan [or Shean] and its small towns; Ibleam and its small towns; the people who lived in Dor and its small towns; the people in ·Naphoth Dor [or Dor, that is, Naphoth; Dor…the third is Naphoth] and its small towns; the people who lived in Taanach and its small towns; the people in Megiddo and its small towns.

12.verse: ·Manasseh [The sons/descendants of Manasseh] was not able to defeat those cities, so the Canaanites ·continued [persisted; were determined] to live there.

13.verse: When the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] grew strong, they forced the Canaanites to work for them, although they did not ·force them to leave the land [drive them out completely; Judg. 1:27–28].

14.verse: The ·people from the tribes [sons/descendants] of Joseph said to Joshua, “You gave ·us [me] only one ·area of land [portion as an inheritance], but ·we are many [I am a great] people. Why did you give us only one part of all the land the LORD gave his people?”

15.verse: And Joshua answered them, “If you have too many people, go up to the forest and ·make a place [clear out land] for yourselves to live there in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaites. The ·mountain [hill] country of Ephraim is too small for you.”

16.verse: The ·people [sons/descendants] of Joseph said, “It is true. The ·mountain [hill] country of Ephraim is not enough for us, but the Canaanites who live in the valley have ·strong armies [iron chariots], both in Beth Shan and all the small towns in that area, and in the Valley of Jezreel.”

17.verse: Then Joshua said to the ·people [house] of Joseph—to Ephraim and Manasseh, “There are many of you, and you have great power. You should be given more than one ·share of land [allotment].

18.verse: You also will have the ·mountain [hill] country. It is a forest, but you can ·cut down the trees and make it a good place to live [clear it and possess its farthest border]. You will own all of it because you will ·force the Canaanites to leave the land [drive out the Canaanites] even though they have ·powerful weapons [iron chariots] and are strong.”

1.verse: The Rest of the Land Divided - All of the Israelites [the whole congregation of the sons/children of Israel] gathered together at Shiloh where they set up the Meeting Tent [Ex. 33:7–11]. The land was now under their control.

2.verse: But there were still seven tribes of Israel that had not yet received their ·land [inheritance].

3.verse: So Joshua said to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel]: “·Why do you wait so long [How long will you delay] to take your land? The LORD, the God of your ancestors, has given this land to you.

4.verse: Choose three men from each tribe, and I will send them out to study the land. They will ·describe in writing [or make a map of] the land their tribe wants as its ·share [inheritance], and then they will come back to me.

5.verse: They will divide the land into seven parts. Judah will keep their land in the south, and the ·people [house] of Joseph will keep their land in the north.

6.verse: You should ·describe [or map out] the seven parts of land in writing and bring what you have written to me. Then I will ·throw [cast] lots in the presence of the LORD our God.

7.verse: But the Levites do not ·get any part of these lands [have an allotment among you], because ·they are priests, and their work is to serve [their portion/inheritance is the priesthood of] the LORD. Gad, Reuben, and ·East [the half-tribe of] Manasseh have received the ·land [inheritance] promised to them, which is east of the Jordan River. Moses, the servant of the LORD, gave it to them [Deut. 3:18–20].”

8.verse: So the men who were chosen to map the land started out. Joshua told them, “Go and study the land and describe it in writing. Then come back to me, and I will ·throw [cast] lots in the presence of the LORD here in Shiloh.”

9.verse: So the men left and ·went into [passed through] the land. They ·described [mapped out] in a scroll each town in the seven parts of the land. Then they came back to Joshua, who was still at the camp at Shiloh.

10.verse: There Joshua ·threw [cast] lots in the presence of the LORD to ·choose [apportion] the lands that should be given to each tribe.

11.verse: Land for Benjamin - The first ·part of the land [lot] was given to the tribe of Benjamin. Each ·family group [clan] received some land between the land of Judah and the land of Joseph. This is the land chosen for Benjamin:

12.verse: The northern border started at the Jordan River and went along the northern ·edge [slope] of Jericho, and then it went west into the ·mountains [hill country]. That boundary continued ·until it was just east [to the desert/wilderness] of Beth Aven.

13.verse: From there it ·went [crossed] south to Luz (also called Bethel) and then down to Ataroth Addar, which is on the hill south of Lower Beth Horon.

14.verse: At the hill to the south of Beth Horon, the border turned and went south near the western side of the hill. It went to Kiriath Baal (also called Kiriath Jearim), a town ·where people of Judah lived [of the sons/descendants of Judah]. This was the western border.

15.verse: The southern border started ·near [at the edge of] Kiriath Jearim and went west to the ·waters [spring] of Nephtoah.

16.verse: Then ·it [the boundary] went down to the bottom of the hill, which was near the Valley of Ben Hinnom, on the north side of the Valley of Rephaim. The border continued down the Hinnom Valley just south of the Jebusite city to En Rogel.

1.verse: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel together at Shechem. He called the elders, heads of families, judges, and officers of Israel to ·stand [present themselves] before God.

5.verse: Then I sent Moses and Aaron to Egypt, where I ·brought many disasters on the Egyptians [plagued Egypt by what I did in their midst; Ex. 1–11]. Afterwards I brought you out [Ex. 12].

6.verse: When I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, they came to the ·Red Sea [Sea], and the Egyptians chased them with chariots and men on horses.

7.verse: So the people called out to the LORD. And ·I [he] brought darkness between you and the Egyptians and made the sea to cover them [Ex. 13–15]. ·You yourselves [Your eyes] saw what I did ·to the army of [in] Egypt. After that, you lived in the ·desert [wilderness] for a long time.

8.verse: “‘Then I brought you to the land of the Amorites, east of the Jordan River. They fought against you, but I handed them over to you. I destroyed them before you, and you took ·control [possession] of that land [Num. 21; Deut. 2–3].

9.verse: But the king of Moab, Balak son of Zippor, ·prepared to fight [arose and fought] against the Israelites. The king sent for Balaam son of Beor to curse you [Num. 22–24],

10.verse: but I refused to listen to Balaam. So he ·asked for good things to happen to you [kept blessing you]! I ·saved you and brought you out of his power [delivered you out of his hand].

11.verse: “‘Then you crossed the Jordan River and came to Jericho, where the ·people [or leaders] of Jericho fought against you. Also, the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites fought against you. But I ·handed them over to you [gave them into your hand].

12.verse: I sent ·terror [or the hornet; the meaning of the Hebrew is uncertain] ahead of you to ·force [drive] out two Amorite kings [2:10; Num. 21:21–35]. ·You took the land without using swords and bows [It was not by your sword or by your bow].

13.verse: I gave you that land where you had not worked. I gave you cities that you did not have to build. And now you live in that land and in those cities, and you eat from vineyards and olive trees that you did not plant.’”

14.verse: Then Joshua said to the people, “Now ·respect [fear; be in awe of] the LORD and serve him ·fully [faithfully; in truth] and sincerely. ·Throw [Put] away the gods that your ancestors worshiped on the other side of the ·Euphrates River [River] and in Egypt. Serve the LORD.

15.verse: But if ·you don’t want [it is undesirable/evil in your eyes] to serve the LORD, you must choose for yourselves today whom you will serve. You may serve the gods that your ancestors worshiped when they lived on the other side of the ·Euphrates River [River], or you may serve the gods of the Amorites who lived in this land. As for me and my ·family [house], we will serve the LORD.”

16.verse: Then the people answered, “·We will never stop following [Far be it from us to forsake] the LORD to serve other gods!

17.verse: It was the LORD our God who brought ·our [us and our] ancestors out of Egypt. ·We were slaves in that land, but […out of the house of slavery, and] the LORD did great ·things [signs] for us there. He brought us out and ·protected [preserved] us while we traveled through other lands.

18.verse: Then he ·forced [drove] out all the people living in these lands, even the Amorites. So we will serve the LORD, because he is our God.”

19.verse: Then Joshua said, “You are not able to serve the LORD, because he is a holy God [Lev. 19:2] and a jealous God [Ex. 20:5]. If you ·turn against him [rebel] and sin, he will not forgive you.

20.verse: If you ·leave [forsake; abandon] the LORD and serve ·other [foreign] gods, he will ·send you great trouble [bring disaster on you]. The LORD may have been good to you, but if you turn against him, he will ·destroy [consume] you.”

21.verse: But the people said to Joshua, “No! We will serve the LORD.”

22.verse: Then Joshua said, “You are your own witnesses that you have chosen to serve the LORD.” The people said, “Yes, we are.”

23.verse: Then Joshua said, “Now throw away the [foreign] gods that ·you have [are in your midst]. ·Love the LORD, the God of Israel, with all your heart [Bend your heart toward the LORD, the God of Israel].”

24.verse: Then the people said to Joshua, “We will serve the LORD our God, and we will obey him.”

25.verse: On that day at Shechem Joshua made an ·agreement [covenant; treaty] for the people. He made ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·laws [regulations] for them to follow.

26.verse: Joshua wrote these things in the Book of the ·Teachings [Law] of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up under the oak tree near the LORD’s ·Holy Tent [sanctuary; shrine; holy place].

27.verse: Joshua said to all the people, “·See [Behold] this stone! It will ·remind you of what we did today [be a witness against you]. ·It was here the LORD spoke to us today [It has heard all the words the LORD said to us]. It will ·remind you of what happened so you will not [be a witness against you, lest you] ·turn against [are untrue to; deal falsely with] your God.”

28.verse: Joshua Dies - Then Joshua sent the people back ·to their land [each to their own inheritance].

29.verse: After that, Joshua son of Nun, the LORD’s servant, died at the age of one hundred ten.

30.verse: They buried him in ·his own land [the land of his inheritance] at Timnath Serah, in the ·mountains [hill country] of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.

31.verse: The Israelites served the LORD during the lifetime of Joshua and during the lifetimes of the elders who lived after Joshua who had ·seen [experienced; known] what the LORD had done for Israel.

32.verse: Joseph Comes Home - When the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] left Egypt, they carried the bones of Joseph with them [Gen. 50:25; Ex. 13:19; Heb. 11:22]. They buried them at Shechem, in the ·land [piece of ground] Jacob had bought for a hundred pieces of silver from the sons of Hamor (Hamor was the father of Shechem) [Gen. 33:19]. This land ·now belonged to [became the inheritance of] Joseph’s children.

33.verse: And Eleazar son of Aaron died and was buried at Gibeah in the ·mountains [hill country] of Ephraim, which had been given to Eleazar’s son Phinehas.
